case_name: University of Gujarat and State of Gujarat v. Shri Krishna Madholkar

facts.text: Shrikant son of Shri Krishna Madholkar appeared for the Secondary School Certificate Examination held by the State of Bombay in March 1960 and was declared successful.

anchor.surface_text: Shrikant son of Shri Krishna Madholkar appeared for the Secondary School Certificate Examination held by the State of Bombay in March, 1960, and was declared successful. He took instruction in the various subjects prescribed for the examination through the medium of Marathi  which is his mother-tongue  and answered the questions at the examination also in the medium of Marathi.

facts.text: Shrikant took instruction in subjects through medium of Marathi, his mother-tongue, and answered questions in Marathi.

anchor.surface_text: He took instruction in the various subjects prescribed for the examination through the medium of Marathi  which is his mother-tongue  and answered the questions at the examination also in the medium of Marathi. Shrikant joined the St. Xaviers College affiliated to the University of Gujarat, in the First Year Arts class and was admitted in the section in which instructions were imparted through the medium of English.

facts.text: Shrikant joined St. Xaviers College affiliated to University of Gujarat in First Year Arts class, admitted to English medium section.

anchor.surface_text: Shrikant joined the St. Xaviers College affiliated to the University of Gujarat, in the First Year Arts class and was admitted in the section in which instructions were imparted through the medium of English. After successfully companypleting the First Year Arts companyrse in March, 1961, Shrikant applied for admission to the classes preparing for the Intermediate Arts examination of the University through the medium of English.

facts.text: Shrikant successfully completed First Year Arts course in March 1961.

anchor.surface_text: After successfully companypleting the First Year Arts companyrse in March, 1961, Shrikant applied for admission to the classes preparing for the Intermediate Arts examination of the University through the medium of English.

facts.text: Principal of St. Xaviers College informed Shrikant that he could not attend English medium classes without University sanction due to Gujarat University Act 1949 and Statutes 207, 208, 209 as amended in 1961.

anchor.surface_text: The Principal of the College informed Shrikant that in view of the provisions of the Gujarat University Act, 1949, and the Statues 207, 208 and 209 framed by the Senate of the University, as amended in 1961 he companyld number without the sanction of the University permit him to attend classes in which instructions were imparted through the medium of English.

facts.text: Shri Krishna, father of Shrikant, moved Vice-Chancellor for sanction to permit Shrikant to attend English medium classes in St. Xaviers College.

anchor.surface_text: Shri Krishna, father of Shrikant then moved the Vice-Chancellor of the University for sanction to permit Shrikant to attend the English medium classes in the St. Xaviers College.

facts.text: Registrar of University declined request but allowed Shrikant to keep English as medium of examination but not for instruction.

anchor.surface_text: The Registrar of the University declined to grant the request, but by another letter Shrikant was allowed to keep English as a medium of examination but number for instruction.

facts.text: Shri Krishna Madholkar filed petition on behalf of himself and son Shrikant in High Court of Gujarat for writ of Mandamus etc. challenging provisions of Gujarat University Act and Statutes.

anchor.surface_text: A petition was then filed by Shri Krishna Madholkar on behalf of himself and his minor son Shrikant in the High Court of Gujarat for a writ or order in the nature of Mandamus or other writ, directions or order requiring the University of Gujarat to treat ss. 4 27 , 18 i  xiv  and 38A of the Gujarat University Act, 1949, and Statues 207, 208 and 209 as void and inoperative...

facts.text: High Court of Gujarat by order dated January 24, 1962 issued the writs prayed for.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court of Gujarat by order dated January 24, 1962, issued the writs prayed for. The University and the State of Gujarat have separately appealed to this Court with certificates of fitness granted by the High Court.

facts.text: University and State of Gujarat appealed to Supreme Court with certificates of fitness from High Court.

anchor.surface_text: The University and the State of Gujarat have separately appealed to this Court with certificates of fitness granted by the High Court.

facts.text: High Court held Statutes 207 and 209 imposing Gujarati/Hindi as media void as unauthorized by Act.

anchor.surface_text: The judgment of the High Court proceeded upon diverse grounds which are summarised in their judgment as follows - Statues 207 and 209 in so far as they seek to lay down and impose Gujarati and or Hindi in Devanagri script as media of instruction and examination in institutions other than those maintained by the University are unauthorised and therefore null and void...

facts.text: Supreme Court declined to hear on Art 29(1) and 30(1) due to lack of pleading and evidence.

anchor.surface_text: We have declined to hear arguments about the alleged infringement of fundamental rights under Articles 29 1  and 30 1  by the Act assuming as it authorises imposition of Gujarati or Hindi as an exclusive medium of instruction, for, in our view, the petition suffers from a singular lack of pleading...

facts.text: St. Xaviers College was affiliated to University of Bombay under Bombay Act 4 of 1928.

anchor.surface_text: St. Xaviers College was affiliated to the University of Bombay under Bombay Act 4 of 1928.

facts.text: Gujarat University Act 1949 enacted to establish teaching and affiliating University for decentralization.

anchor.surface_text: The Legislature of the Province of Bombay enacted the Gujarat University Act, 1949, to establish and incorporate a teaching and affiliating University as a measure of decentralization and re-organisation of University education in the province.

facts.text: By s.5(3) of Gujarat University Act, institutions in Gujarat area deemed affiliated to Gujarat University from prescribed date.

anchor.surface_text: By s. 5 3  of the Act, from the prescribed date all educational institutions admitted to the privileges of the University of Bombay and situate within the University area of Gujarat were deemed to be admitted to the privileges of the University of Gujarat.

facts.text: Statutes 207, 208, 209 framed in 1954 dealing with media of instruction.

anchor.surface_text: In 1954, the Gujarat University framed certain Regulations dealing with the media of instruction. They are Statues 207, 208 and 209.

facts.text: Statute 207 provided Gujarati as medium, English to continue up to 10 years, options for Hindi etc.

anchor.surface_text: Statute 207 provided - Gujarati shall be medium of Instruction and Examination. Notwithstanding anything in clause  1  above, English shall companytinue to be the medium of instruction and examination for a period number exceeding ten years...

facts.text: Act 4 of 1961 amended proviso to s.4(27) and enacted s.38A imposing obligation on colleges to comply with media provisions.

anchor.surface_text: After the companystitution of a separate State of Gujarat, Act 4 of 1961 was enacted by the Gujarat State Legislature. By that Act the proviso to s. 4 27  was amended...

facts.text: Senate amended Statutes 207 and 209 after Act 4 of 1961.

anchor.surface_text: The Senate of the University thereafter amended Statues 207 and 209.

facts.text: Registrar issued circular on June 22, 1961 permitting English medium only for certain students who had prior English medium SSC and FY.

anchor.surface_text: The Registrar of the University thereafter issued a circular on June 22, 1961, addressed to Principals of Affiliated Colleges stating that the Vice-Chancellor...

facts.text: Shrikant had not appeared at SSC in English medium, so could not use English for Intermediate Arts.

anchor.surface_text: Shrikant had number appeared at the S.S.C. Examination in the medium of English and under the first clause of the circular he companyld number be permitted...

facts.text: Supreme Court held University has no power under Act to prescribe Gujarati or Hindi as exclusive medium.

anchor.surface_text: We accordingly agree with the High Court that power to impose Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media has number been companyferred under clause  27  or any other clauses of s. 4.

facts.text: Supreme Court set aside High Court declaration that proviso to s.4(27) and s.38A invalid.

anchor.surface_text: We set aside the order of the High Court in so far as it declares s. 4 clause  27  proviso and s. 38A invalid.

issues.text: whether under the Gujarat University Act, 1949, it is open to the University to prescribe Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media of instruction and examination in the affiliated colleges

anchor.surface_text: Two substantial questions survive for determination -  1  whether under the Gujarat University Act, 1949, it is open to the University to prescribe Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media of instruction and examination in the affiliated colleges,

issues.text: whether legislation authorising the University to impose such media would infringe Entry 66 of List I, Seventh Schedule to the Constitution

anchor.surface_text: and  2  whether legislation authorising the University to impose such media would infringe Entry 66 of List I, Seventh Schedule to the Constitution. St. Xaviers College was affiliated to the University of Bombay under Bombay Act 4 of 1928.

issues.text: whether the provisions of the Act and the Statutes and circulars issued infringe fundamental rights under Articles 29(1) and 30(1) of the Constitution

anchor.surface_text: Even if on a true construction of s. 4 27  and other provisions of the Act, the University is authorised to prescribed a particular language or languages as medium or media of instruction and examination for affiliated colleges and to prohibit the use of English as a medium of instruction and examination in affiliated colleges, the provisions authorising the imposition of exclusive media and the Statutes and circulars issued in pursuance thereof are void and infringing Articles 29 1  and 30 1  of the Constitution.

holdings.text: The University has no power under the Gujarat University Act, 1949, or as amended, to prescribe Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media of instruction and examination in affiliated colleges.

anchor.surface_text: We accordingly agree with the High Court that power to impose Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media has not been conferred under clause 27 or any other clauses of s. 4.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Textual interpretation of s.4 clauses (1,2,7,8,10,14,27,28), s.18(1)(xiv); 'promote...as a medium' means one of several, not exclusive; no express or implied power; proviso continues English.

holdings.text: Statutes 207 and 209 are invalid insofar as they impose Gujarati or Hindi as exclusive media of instruction.

anchor.surface_text: We accordingly agree with the High Court that power to impose Gujarati or Hindi or both as an exclusive medium or media has not been conferred under clause 27 or any other clauses of s. 4.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Ultra vires the Act as University lacks power to impose exclusive medium; High Court order confirmed.

holdings.text: The proviso to s.4(27) as amended by Act 4 of 1961 and s.38A are valid and within State legislative competence.

anchor.surface_text: We set aside the order of the High Court in so far as it declares s. 4 clause 27 proviso and s. 38A invalid.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Amendment extends English medium continuance, does not confer or enable exclusive regional medium; no encroachment on Entry 66 as maintains pre-existing common medium.

holdings.text: State Legislature is competent under Entry 11 List II to prescribe exclusive medium of instruction unless it prejudicially affects coordination and determination of standards under Entry 66 List I.

anchor.surface_text: Power to legislate in respect of medium of instruction, in so far it has a direct bearing and impact upon the legislative head of coordination and determination of standards in institutions of higher education...

holdings.reasoning_summary: Harmonious construction of Entries 11 List II (subject to 63-66 List I) and 66 List I; medium integral to education but Union overrides if impacts standards; pith/substance considers degree of invasion.

anchor.surface_text: The order of the High Court relating to the invalidity of the Statutes 207 and 209 of the University in so far as they purport to impose Gujarati or Hindi or both as exclusive medium or media of instruction, and the circulars enforcing those statutes must therefore be confirmed. We do not express any opinion on the alleged infringement of fundamental rights of the petitioner under Arts. 29(1), 30(1) of the Constitution. We set aside the order of the High Court in so far as it declares s. 4 clause (27) proviso and s. 38A invalid.

outcome.relief_summary: High Court order confirmed declaring Statutes 207, 209 and circulars invalid for imposing exclusive Gujarati/Hindi medium; set aside declaration invalidating proviso to s.4(27) and s.38A; no opinion on Arts. 29(1) & 30(1)
directions: Appellants to pay costs of respondents in the two appeals. One hearing fee.
